@mwinkle @Oli4Twist thought a fundamental premise of hadoop was data distributed physically on compute nodes & move as little as possible

@timsneath CowBit Edition
@Si_ShaunRyan @Oli4Twist you can size clusters independent of storage, and most cloud services can natively dump data to cloud storage (3/3)
@mwinkle @Oli4Twist Defo there's flexibility there. I'm not sure how it sits physically behind the scenes.
@Si_ShaunRyan @Oli4Twist the physics do change leveraging cloud storage, but there is a tradeoff in terms of flexibility & interop (2/3)
@Si_ShaunRyan @Oli4Twist tell me a bit more about that, is that due to concerns on perf or management or ??? (1/3)
@Oli4Twist @Si_ShaunRyan rather than interactive (at this time), the 'load to dw' scenario is something we see a lot of interest in (2/2)

@mwinkle Yeah, get the PaaS part.  Customer doesn't want HDInsight because he says it locks him to Azure.
@dunnry running Hadoop in IaaS gives you full control, but at the end of the day, you still need to operate, manage and monitor your cluster
@dunnry HDInsight is a 'managed service', eg, we run it, provide an SLA, wake up @ 3am if something breaks, etc.
